results.title: Amanda Seyfried Finally Stakes Her Claim
results.abstract: The “Mean Girls” and “Mamma Mia!” actress knows her performance as Marion Davies in“Mank” will be a turning point in her career. But first, she had to put some distance between herself and Hollywood.

results.title: Some Movies Actually Understand Poverty in America
results.abstract: The complex realities of subsistence escape “Hillbilly Elegy.” But as far back as Charlie Chaplin’s “City Lights,” filmmakers have been turning a discerning eye on destitution.

multimedia.caption: Glenn Close as Mamaw, a grandmother subsisting on Meals on Wheels, in “Hillbilly Elegy.”

results.title: HBO Documentary Has Competition. These Women Don’t Seem Worried.
results.abstract: These days everybody wants a piece of the nonfiction game. HBO’s documentary heads, Nancy Abraham and Lisa Heller, talked about how they’re navigating the evolving landscape.

multimedia.caption: Lisa Heller, left, and Nancy Abraham took over HBO’s documentary department in 2018 amid seismic changes in how documentaries are made, distributed and watched.

results.abstract: Mr. Prowse went from being a weight lifting champion in Britain to helping portray one of the most memorable villains in movie history. But his voice did not make the edit.

results.abstract: That Tokyo trip will have to wait for the millions of people who canceled flights and hotel bookings. But there are ways to bring you closer to this sometimes impenetrable, always fascinating, city.

On TikTok, Fans Are Making Their Own ‘Ratatouille’ Musical
results.abstract: Thousands of TikTok users, including musical theater professionals, are creating a Broadway-style adaptation of the animated Disney film about a rat with culinary aspirations.
